item.title: Mathematical Constants in C++
item.description: None of C++ standards has defined π number. So every programmer who needs to do some math including, for example, trigonomerty or statistics, has to define π herself. Luckily header files have defined π (See M_PI in math.h). Though it is not ultimately safe and portable to use these constants. It might casue numeric errors in critical applications. In this blog post, I am going to show a better way to reach a safe π.
